alert.note: Alert for Kootenai; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 04 at 8:37AM MDT until May 07 at 11:08PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. For the Coeur d`Alene River...including Cataldo...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, The County may begin pumping operations behind levels above this stage if the river is expected to remain over flood stage for a long duration. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 42.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow afternoon. The river is forecast to crest Saturday and begin to recede early next week. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Coeur d Alene River Cataldo 43.0 42.3 Thu 6 am PDT 42.0 44.4 43.4 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM PDT.
